channel.title: Could not find or load main class AlertHandler.java
channel.description:
Currently Running Ubuntu and Downloaded "TrisidiaX V3 Final Release," it came with a source and client. I cannot launch the client nor compile it.
I converted the .bat
[code] @echo off title TrisidiaX Client color B cd Trisidia echo Your JDK is working perfectly fine. - Trisidia "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_09\bin\java.exe" -Xmx300m ShowMessageDialog pause [/code]
to .sh
[code] #!/bin/bash java -Xmx300m ShowMessageDialog [/code]
ran in terminal and then a window popped up with two different options; popout client and webclient. Clicking both I recieve... [code] Cannot run program "initiate.bat": error=2, No such file or directory [/code]
I then searched for "ShowMessageDialog" in the directory found it, found initiate.bat here; changed it to initiate.sh
[code] }
public class MyAction implements ActionListener {
public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent ae){ String str = ae.getActionCommand(); if(str.equals("Popout Client")){ JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You have selected the popout client, and it will now launch.", "Popout client selected", 1); try { Runtime.getRuntime().exec("initiate.sh");<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<Here terminateApplet(); } catch (Exception e){ System.out.println(e.getMessage()); } } [/code]
and converted the initiate.bat from
[code] @echo off Title TrisidiaX Client cd ./Class/ START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 exit [/code]
to
[code] #!/bin/bash cd ./Class/ java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 [/code]
and still recieved the same message, cannot run program. So I decided maybe I need to just compile the client? The compiler.sh looks like [code] #!/bin/bash java *.java [/code]
When I run it I receive [code] Could not find or load main class AlertHandler.java [/code]
Am I even on the right track? What am I doing wrong?

item.title: Could not find or load main class AlertHandler.java
item.dc:creator: @xXLyonsXx xXLyonsXx
item.description:
@xXLyonsXx wrote:

Currently Running Ubuntu and Downloaded “TrisidiaX V3 Final Release,” it came with a source and client. I cannot launch the client nor compile it.

I converted the .bat

@echo off
title TrisidiaX Client
color B
cd Trisidia
echo Your JDK is working perfectly fine.  - Trisidia
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_09\bin\java.exe" -Xmx300m ShowMessageDialog
pause

to .sh

#!/bin/bash
java -Xmx300m ShowMessageDialog

ran in terminal and then a window popped up with two different options; popout client and webclient. Clicking both I recieve…

Cannot run program "initiate.bat": error=2, No such file or directory

I then searched for “ShowMessageDialog” in the directory found it, found initiate.bat here; changed it to initiate.sh

	}

	public class MyAction implements ActionListener {
	
		public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent ae){
			String str = ae.getActionCommand();
			if(str.equals("Popout Client")){
				JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You have selected the popout client, and it will now launch.", "Popout client selected", 1);
				try {
				Runtime.getRuntime().exec("initiate.sh");<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<Here
				terminateApplet();
			}
			catch (Exception e){
			System.out.println(e.getMessage());
			}
		}

and converted the initiate.bat from

@echo off
Title TrisidiaX Client
cd ./Class/
START java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32
exit

to

#!/bin/bash
cd ./Class/
java -Xmx512m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32

and still recieved the same message, cannot run program. So I decided maybe I need to just compile the client? The compiler.sh looks like

#!/bin/bash
java *.java

When I run it I receive

Could not find or load main class AlertHandler.java

Am I even on the right track? What am I doing wrong?

Read full topic
item.source: Could not find or load main class AlertHandler.java
